newsitem.title: CYPRUS: Cyprus bourse lifts suspension of cement firms.
newsitem.headline: Cyprus bourse lifts suspension of cement firms.

text.p: The Cyprus Stock Exchange (CSE) lifted on Monday a three-week suspension of trading in shares of Vassiliko Cement and the Cyprus Cement Company .
Bourse sources told Reuters the decision to lift the suspension was taken after parliament last week approved legislation regulating mergers and acquisitions.
A CSE statement issued to brokers before Monday's trading session started merely stated the suspension was lifted.

The CSE temporarily suspended trading in shares of the two companies on March 11 amid unconfirmed reports that Cyprus Cement was making a bid to buy a considerable number of shares in Vassiliko which could give it control over the firm.
Italy's Italcementi owns 33 percent of Vassiliko.
The law guarantees equal treatment of shareholders in bid situations, with offers being made on a pro-rata basis.
